attributes.action: Reverse recent LTNs/Tfl road changes/closures now, due to traffic chaos.
attributes.additional_details: These changes were started by a time-based grant from central government in response to covid-19  They have negatively and seriously impacted the lives of many residents and workers all over London.  Local councils hurried to implement them without, it would appear, any co-ordination with Tfl, which is causing cross borough issues.  People have been pushed out of the roads and the alternative (walk/cycle) is not suitable for all.  It's discriminatory.  Some people have no alternative.
attributes.background: Recent London LTNs have been put in place with a live consultation period of 6 months.  Many areas have experienced them for a few weeks and want them gone NOW, not in 6 months.  People are reporting high levels of stress and frustration. There is no reason to prolong it.  Reverse them now!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Transport is the responsibility of the London Assembly and the London Mayor, and local councils. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
